AD_Signpost.synopsis: AD on signpost in the shadow cursed lands. The road is twisted and broken, the sign is leaning at an odd angle, but you can still read that there's an inn to the north and Moonrise towers to the west.

AD_MountainPassSignpost.synopsis: AD on signpost in the shadow cursed lands. The road is twisted and broken, the sign is leaning at an odd angle, but you can still read that Moonrise is ahead on the West. If you will follow the road you will eventually hit the Town and Moonrise.

PAD_HalsinBridge.synopsis: Halsin remembers his previous battle in SCL
PAD_HalsinBridge.how_to_trigger: With Halsin as a companion, walk across the bridge from SCL in to TWN arround coords -53, 22, -77

VB_RoadToPlains.synopsis: Player is approaching one of the exits to the Shadow Cursed lands. Following this road will take them back to the Plains.

automatic_ordering.reasoning: All provided sessions occur in or around the Shadow Cursed Lands. Two of the sessions (AD_Signpost and AD_MountainPassSignpost) are both signposts in the area but give slightly different navigational hints – one mentions an inn to the north along with Moonrise towers to the west, while the other only mentions Moonrise ahead when following the road. This suggests they come from exploring divergent pathways through the same region and are therefore mutually exclusive: if the player takes one road they might not encounter the other. In addition, the two sessions that represent leaving the Shadow Cursed Lands – PAD_HalsinBridge and VB_RoadToPlains – are triggered by moving out of SCL via different routes: PAD_HalsinBridge requires you to cross a bridge from SCL into town with Halsin as a companion, while VB_RoadToPlains is encountered when you head toward an exit that leads to the Plains. This implies an ordering constraint in that the signpost sessions (which occur within or right upon entering the cursed lands) come before any “exit” session, and also suggests that the two exit events are mutually exclusive, since the player chooses one route over the other. Therefore, we establish the following ordering rules: both signpost sessions must precede any exit event (i.e. PAD_HalsinBridge and VB_RoadToPlains) because they inform the player’s navigation within SCL. Finally, we add exclusivity rules: the signpost sessions are mutually exclusive (the player only follows one path and sees one signpost) and the two exit sessions are mutually exclusive as the player chooses one exit route over the other.
